was having the same issue and addressed it without going into the OS specific code, just by forcing a refresh on a component. here's how:
1. bind some global variable to a component's key
```
<template lang="pug">
.wrapper
    router-view(:key="store.resetView") # store.resetView initializes as integer = 0
</template>
```
2. Install Nat.js Library _(maybe it can be done without, but I need it anyway for other things)_
3. create orientation variable in store and set interval polling of Nat.screen.orientation.status every 500ms
4. compare current orientation value with the one in store, if different, add 1 to resetView
```
<script lang="coffee">
module.exports =
    methods:
        rotationInterval: ->
            Nat.screen.orientation.status (err, ret) =>
                if @orientation != ret.orientation
                   ++@store.resetView
                   @orientation = ret.orientation
</script>
```

this will force the component to refresh every time a screen rotation is detected by the Nat component

Hi @lucky-chen we observed that Weex sdk version 0.20 is creating only 32 bit of .so files for ARM and x86 Platform. Suppose it should create some more folder like **lib/arm64-v8a and lib/x86_64** to support 64 bit libraries . Ref link : https://developer.android.com/distribute/best-practices/develop/64-bit

1. Release of Weex need to be voted with at least three `agree` reposone. If you really need it, there are two options:
    * Help to propose a release for Weex. I'm happy to guide you the procedure and corresponding issue.
    * Wait for the next release, which may happen in one or two month later (*The schedule is unknown, as we need to [vote for a release](http://www.apache.org/legal/release-policy.html#contents) like any other Apache projects do*)
2. Please follow the issue template and provide your demo.
